Reviews.Title: Works well, better IR than others claiming 3 x the distance
Reviews.Author: HomeTheaterLover
Reviews.Content: This is the first of 3 cameras I purchased.  With a little understanding of networks, this camera was simple to setup.  It is very stable and has a rock solid picture over Wi-Fi.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the audio quality.  The Wi-Fi antenna causes a repetitive buzz in the audio.  Mounting the camera up side down or moving the antenna away from the camera head removes some of the noise but not all of it.  This camera needs shielding between the audio circuitry and the CPU / Data circuits.It is noisier than others when you turn it and it can be heard through the audio loudly.  As for picture quality, both in the dark and during the day it is pretty good for the price point.  The picture in the dark is amazing, lights up the whole room, does better than it states. (~16 feet or 5 meters).  This camera lights up brightly 20 feet away without adjusting brightness or contrast.While it lacks the ability to use sound triggers for recording with their Blue Iris software due to the internal noise and AGC circuitry, this is an amazing camera for the price.  Works very well using motion detection on maximum and doesn't give any false alarms due to picture instability or noise from compression.  Uses about 2.5 Mb/s (megabits per second) Wi-Fi bandwidth.  Most 802.11(G) routers will handle 21 Mb/s so you can put quite a few of these cameras on your Wi-Fi without much lag.  Frame rate for me has been about 15-18 fps which is lower than advertised but still acceptable.

Reviews.Title: da ge is watching
Reviews.Author: W. Wolff
Reviews.Content: Made in China. I'll explain below why this may be a serious issue.This camera works nicely. This is the second one I've purchased to watch the caregivers who give care to my elderly parents.The only software I have to operate it is what comes with it. The software is adequate, permitting me to view and record, with audio and timestamp, multiple cameras simultaneously. The camera operates easily from the software, panning left-right and up-down. The camera can be focused for a range of distances, but only manually so far, since the default software doesn't operate this. I don't know whether the focus can be operated by software.When you install the camera, it is given a local IP address on your LAN. The view/record software operates through your browser. However, with multiple cameras, regardless of which IP address you enter, the software selects the first installed camera. You can then include additional cameras in multiple view windows (4 or 9 simultaneously), but you can't view any single camera. Only the first camera can be viewed individually.Microsoft Windows is the preferred operating system and Internet Explorer (IE) is the preferred browser. Only IE provides full functionality. With other browsers, and hence other operating systems, you cannot access multiple cameras connected to your network simultaneously, you cannot access the audio input or output, and you cannot record. These features are available only with IE.The software controls, e.g., panning and recording, operate on any selected camera. The selected camera's image is highlighted with a yellow border. The other camera images are highlighted in white. This may be difficult to distinguish. When any one camera has been set to record, the record icon changes to a stop icon. When any camera's audio has been enabled for recording, the record icon changes to a stop icon. When another camera is selected, the icons remain in their stop appearance. So you can't tell from the icons the state of an individual camera. If you have turned timestamp on for a camera, the timestamp appears at the bottom of that camera's image. The timestamp indicates "recording" and "audio", so you need to look at the timestamp to see the state of each camera. If a camera isn't recording or doesn't have its audio on, clicking the record and audio icons turns recording and audio on, even if the icons are in the stop position when you click them. They don't affect recording or audio of unselected cameras. Of course, when they're in the stop position, you can't tell what function they represent, because they just appear as a small square. You must remember the function of each icon by its position on screen.Four stars because I would like better software. Even if I had to buy software, I would give this another star if the manufacturer would tell me what software I can use. (As a computer engineer, I'm considering writing my own. But that's not my first choice. And it won't help anyone else who's considering buying this.)The camera can be given a WAN port for Internet access, e.g., view from a computer, smart phone, or tablet via browser from anywhere in the world, if you know the public IP address, fixed at the factory, port number that you assign, username that you assign, and password that you assign.(Now, here it's important to know that I am a computer engineer who has developed a variety of embedded electronic systems.) Engineers frequently include a so-called back door in their products especially for troubleshooting. This isn't done maliciously, but can be used maliciously. Regardless of the alleged security of having you select a port, username, and password that no one else knows. it is possible that the camera has a back door that can be opened by anyone who knows the key. That key may be known by anyone at the manufacturer. But also, anyone who buys one of these cameras can read the firmware and find the key.This means also that, if such a back door exists, it just wouldn't matter what you were doing with the camera, e.g., watching, recording, or even neither watching nor recording. As long as the camera is powered on and is connected to your LAN and your LAN is connected to the Internet, it can be accessed from the Internet. Even without a back door, it may be possible to hack into the camera, as well as any other device on your Internet-connected LAN.I wouldn't worry too much about having this camera in an area where I wouldn't be concerned about keeping my windows open to the world. But i wouldn't place this camera in any sensitive area.Oh, yeah. About the title for this review. da ge means big brother in Chinese (approximate Mandarin pronunciation). :)

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Craig Fields
Reviews.Content: Installed 2 of these today on my home network. You need to set them up at first with a wired connection to your router, after you edit the wireless settings they are good to go and you can move them anywhere, default IP address for both was: 192.168.0.178, if that helps. They work nicely whether you are on your home router or viewing over 3g, however my lousy Sprint 3g with 2 bars at my house is painfully slow, but still barely usable. Sprint promises "unlimited" data but since their 3g is so slow, I now know why as there's no way I can consume inordinate amounts of data on their painfully slow 3g network, Verizon in this area kicks Sprint's butt all over the place speed-wise.The night-vision is very good as is the overall picture quality, I can't emphasize enough how good the night vision image is, it's fantastic, in low light or literally pitch black it's black and white, not greenish as you might expect and goes out at least 17 feet clearly. With decent lighting the colors are a still a bit washed out, whether on a web browser or my iPhone 4s. The Wansview iPhone app from the app store (search on wansview) is free and adequate, as is the web interface provided to your browser, I have since bought two different apps (total $15) that allow more than one camera on the iPhone screen, they are both very good, though no app can turn off the infrared lights which I believe are controlled by the ambient light available, and some don't work with the audio. I recommend the the uFoscam app at $3.99 with the in-app purchase of multiview at $2.99, total is $7.00 and the "listen" audio works, not the mic though. Windows users should be aware the "publisher" of the ocx control for IE can not be verified and will raise a flag (for those of you savvy enough to not run as the Admininstrator, you'll have to provide the password on over-ride), not surprising given the Chinese origin and low price of these cameras. Linux users don't need the ocx control and the cameras work nicely on Firefox. I recommend Windows users go with Firefox or Chrome, no ocx to download and install, nor any over-ride of an unknown publisher required.I have a sneaking suspicion these cameras have some kind of back-door that allows someone in China to view their output, call me paranoid, but I just feel it. I certainly would not use their offered dynamic dns option, nor keep them on 24/7 if I were you.

Reviews.Title: No Sound
Reviews.Author: P. Narayan
Reviews.Content: It has no audio. Otherwise video seems to be working fine.I'll contact seller to get more info. If audio does not work, I'd probably return it.

Reviews.Title: Wansview IP Camera
Reviews.Author: kdmetal
Reviews.Content: I bought this product to view my home in Florida while out of town. It seems to be a very dependable camera but you better have some computer expierence to hook this one up. Direction on hook up need some improvements as the china to american interpretation is very poor. Once you master the port forwarding from your router it has worked to my expectations.  I will give it a 2 stars as far as ease of hooking this up and 4 star as to the operation and performance.

Reviews.Title: Wansview Wireless IP Camera Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision/ Internet Surveillance
Reviews.Author: h
Reviews.Content: I love these IP Cameras. I bought the first one over a 18 months ago and they still work. One of them is outside under an overhang and has been working well. I have set it up so it sends me emails when there is motion to keep an eye on my yard. It does it well. The only drawback is that I get too many false alarm emails when the light changes due to clouds and shade movement. But it is a small price to pay. The picture quality is not that good but is sufficient to know what's going on around your house.By the way these work better than the more expensive outdoor version of the Wansview IP camera. The outdoor version does not have the same wide angle lens as this one and it is fixed with no pan/tilt capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Security camera
Reviews.Author: ray
Reviews.Content: Works ok but was hard to set up. I wish the picture quality was better. After playing with device for a awhile I figured it out. I had to refer to the enternet for more information. The maual needed to be more detailed on each step.

Reviews.Title: Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Eric Beato
Reviews.Content: Great product. I would recommend it to anybody who is interested in home monitoring while is out of town.It really works.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera so Far!
Reviews.Author: LadyAzul7
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera and had it running in 45 min, took me longer for trying to follow the instructions from the box.  For the price it has a great resolution and image looks great.  I gave it a 4 stars because I don't know how reliable it is yet... I will update later after I have it for a while.I originally purchased a Foscam, which is very similar but much more expensive, but the speaker didn't work from the beginning, so then I order a Tenvis and to my surprise the resolution and quality of the video and audio where the same, they also were very stable and never went down. So I returned the Foscam and order this Wansview for over $30 cheaper and they all look about the same.  But I like the instructions and the web interface on this Wansview better then the Tenvis.I use this cameras instead of baby monitors and they work much better,  I paid $160 when my daughter was born for a baby monitor (Summer) that is black and white, and looks creepy at night. For the price this is much better option.  I purchase this cameras to replace them since we moved to a two story home and she started sleeping in her room alone for the first time, she feels more safe and she asks me to watch her while she sleeps, that really helped with the transition of sleeping alone. This cameras turned out to be great, the night view looks very clear, and I can hear very well.  Since I'm able to move it around, I can keep an eye to know what she is doing or when she plays with her cousins, and not have to run up and down the stairs constantly.  Now I know if or who is fighting or if they are just playing or making a mess. I have it set up with my Samsung II using a $4 app called "IP Cam Viewer" and works great. I also set it up to be able to access it from anywhere, this is very nice to have when i'm not home.I was able to set up this Wansview to send alarm pictures to my email address and that works really good too. I do recommend that you use the instructions that are on the CD and NOT to use the instructors that come with the box.Here are some tips:*  Connect the computer with a cable (not wireless) to the same router where you connect the camera.*  When you insert the CD click on the "BSearch_en"*  Open the "Wabsview NCB IP camera user manual"*  When you are in the "BSeries .." screen,  under the "Authentication" make sure that you use the "admin" and the "123456"  then update it.  You will be able to change this credentials later when you get to the web interface, but for this set up, you must use this.Follow the steps on this manual, I was trying to follow the little book and was taking me longer.Hope this helps other buyers or parents.  Let me know if you are having issues and I may help.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: HyperCams
Reviews.Content: Seriously, if you are looking at this camera you should have already seen the good and bad reviews and everything related(specs, price, compatibility(if even applicable), etc)..RULE #1...the ONLY rule you need to know!***READ/USE the top review for this camera***You will NEED to use some of the tips and things suggested in that review just to get this camera working.Now, getting it to work OUTside your network?? no thanks.That is a whole different ballgame..for me..You need either: Masters in Computer Science/networking, or be a 14yr old wiz kid..! LOLThe manual is definitely needed, and IMHO, worthy of being called a manual...or I guess "fold out" quick start guide kinda thing..I used the manual to completely setup the camera to my PC(directly wired to the router), and then the #1 review above for the rest of the config for getting this to work on the wireless from our Apple and Android phones/tabs/etc..I highly recommend getting the app, "Bi Smartey" for either Apple or Android. It works MUCH better than just using a web browser..You can Pan/Tilt the camera so that it "patrols/sweeps" from the app. You cannot do this from the MOBILE browser interface. So you have to move the camera step by step with every click on your phone's screen...it takes a few minutes to go the full rotation of the camera.That brings up one REALLY important spec of this camera that is either not explained very well...This camera does NOT rotate 270deg horizontally......it is more like 300-320deg!!! There is almost ZERO gap in coverage from side to side..it is great!Also, some reviews said the audio was not working/good/etc..Our's works fine. the MIC does NOT work on the camera(or atleast we have not noticed it yet), but the camera DOES "play" sounds when you speak into your phone's MIC.etc..I do think I will "fiddle" with this (I am an electrical engineer) to see if I can get a good MIC working on it to be more useful as a baby,nursery monitor...I recommend this camera to everyone I know. It is awesome! And has already proven its worth.(we bought it to catch our dogs, or to see which dog was eating paper items(magazines/books/DVD cover sleeves/etc left on the coffee table, or even hidden way up out of reach...)  throughout the house when we had left the house.We caught them within the first 20min that the camera was up and running. ;-)Will get another one for the nursery once the baby is born!Cheers!Brent

Reviews.Title: it works great!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Packaging was excellent, it arrived exactly when it was supposed to.You have to be smarter than the camera... well, not exactly, but it helps.  Most people pitch a fit about the lousy docs that have poorly written instructions.  Apparently they forget to look on the CD that comes with the camera.  I used the quick install instructions to get the camera up and running.  THOSE instructions are indeed poor quality and tiny.  I used a magnifying glass. Then I took a look at the CD.  Very good instructions, PDF files or Word, in decent English.  Within 30 minutes of plugging power to it, I pulled the pic up on my tablet via WIFI.  Then I called one of my sons across town, gave him my IP/port address/passwords and told him to hit it.  He was impressed with the quality of pic and the ability to make it tilt and pan.  I hit the lights and the room was still lit up like daylight.  30 minutes tops for an install.  I haven't tried the alarms and sound yet, I'm gonna wait until I have it installed on the ceiling before I go there.  I will admit to 30 years of computer experience, but this was something totally new to me.  The key is to check out the docs on the CD.

Reviews.Title: Product came as NCL615W, instead of NCB541W
Reviews.Author: Kamaaina Brah
Reviews.Content: Seems like they made a product replacement or sent me the wrong unit, but looks like I got a slightly more expensive unit, so what the heck, I thought I'd checked it out.First COMPLAINT, the manuals are very very poorly written. I had to navigate myself to get the wired and wireless feature to work. I was unable to get port forwarding for the WAN feature to work. Upside, I got the Iphone with 3G capability to work. You almost need a PhD in electrical engineering with expertise in network engineering just to get the damn thing to work for these simple features. That is for someone in the know.Iif u are totally clueless, you'd likely return it and charge it to "the damn thing does not work !"The manual recording works. However, the scheduled recording works intermittently. Which means, getting it to start and stop the scheduled recording was a BIG problem. I got it to work only ONCE. Sometimes, if I manually started the recording it will stop at a scheduled time. For the most part, the start-stop scheduled recording never works.It is strange going to the Camera setup, the camera time is different from the PC. Like my PC is set at Pacific time. To get the time to synchronize, I had to set the camera to mountain time. I don't understand why this is so. There is no option for daylight savings.Spelling....they spelled scanning as "scaning"....now u know it is a made in China crap. That explains why the manual is poorly written and the software is also poorly engineered.For what's it's worth, it works about 50%, but key features. like scheduled recordings need to always work not intermittently, If  I have to figure a get around, this is also BS.If u don't need all the features to work, then for the price, it will be ok. If u are trying to max your use out of this, u aint going to get it !!

Reviews.Title: don't buy it
Reviews.Author: wendell s.
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 cameras. one works - sort of and the other didn't work right out of the box. There is no tech support. Manuals are in broken English. It's impossible to download anything off their website. When I tried to download I swear they were trying to load a virus or something worse on my computer. My computer locked up and I had to shut down. I will never purchase from them again. Seems like a scam, don't know why Amazon is involved with them.

Reviews.Title: Ok but
Reviews.Author: Tonatiuh
Reviews.Content: The camera is good, but the procedure to configure the remote view is not easy for a beginner, like me

Reviews.Title: Geeat camera
Reviews.Author: AlanK
Reviews.Content: I have aeveral foscams and this camera's performance is comparable.  Installation is a pain but i have written down my routine and if i follow it, everything works.

Reviews.Title: the little camera that could
Reviews.Author: H. sahay "gadget junkie"
Reviews.Content: I love this cameraIt is cheap and it works great. I have three of them.One behind my house - mounted outside in the balcony - overlooking the parking lot.One in the loft overlooking much of the house andOne in the front balcony - again mounted outside - overlooking the front entrance and the road and tot lot and such.Easy to configure if you have even basic networking skills.The alert function is not very configurable and i didn't like the sensitivity levels this camera offers out of box. So I purchased the blue iris software that now control all the three cameras and gives me a unified view from outside the home - weather from the office or from the road via my iphone.

Reviews.Title: Too difficult to setup.
Reviews.Author: Vidhi Talreja
Reviews.Content: Too difficult to setup. Its difficult for even a the savvy person to set this up. I should have gone for Dropcam.

Reviews.Title: This MIGHT be great....if I could get it to work
Reviews.Author: Poorer but Wiser
Reviews.Content: OK, I'm no dummy, but I'm not a computer engineer, either. I followed all the directions, but I simply cannot get my computer network to "see" this camera.I guess I'll ask for help from a teenager.

Reviews.Title: pain to connect
Reviews.Author: Rick Eram
Reviews.Content: very poor documentation. Very hard to figure out how to connect. Avoid if you are not technical enough to know about networking and computer saavy enough

Reviews.Title: Works like a Charm
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Just make sure you download the instructions for this camera from the internet.  It does make it a little easier to get this thing to work.  The hardest part of the whole installation is deciding where you want to put the camera.  We have our watching our pet door just to see if anything other than our cats are coming in and out.  So far, only kitties.  Thinking about ordering another one this year.  Guess I will work on permanent installation soon.  LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: the best thing i purchased ever!
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: with these ip cams accessable by my galaxy s4,ipads and pcs, i can view my home  from anywhere in the world! and that is just the tip of the iceberg. it can be wired to any existing alarm system to act as motion sensor that can send you snaphots of the event.via email. it has an output  switch that you can toggle from your phone anywhere. this can be used to open the garage door, turn on the lights, or even feed the aquarium fishes, turn on the water sprinkler, or even a loud siren,  etc., etc. i am highly recommending this particular brand  because of its active server and ease of installations. Unlike other similar ip cams that no longer have manufacturer domain that gives out free dns address,which is very critical when viewing the ipcams through the internet. i have 4 of these units and im planning to add at least 2 more!

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.  Directions could be easier to understand.
Reviews.Author: jeff rooks
Reviews.Content: Good for the price.  Directions could be easier to understand.Not for outdoor use.  Works ok in light or dark.

Reviews.Title: Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Terry McBride
Reviews.Content: Bought camera to keep track of the grand kids when they play in the back yard.  It is not an outdoor camera but it is in a protected area and works great.  Great price!

Reviews.Title: Passable as a general security camera but colors are totally inaccurate
Reviews.Author: Martin Waterhouse "Lostinspace"
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a bargain Wireless IP Webcam. Despite the poor documentation I had no problem setting it up and getting it working with my monitoring software. At longer range (over 40 ft) wireless communication was somewhat lackluster showing a lot of dropped packets and periodically losing the signal altogether. However it could be dramatically improved using a high-gain antenna or wired connection. Other wireless devices at the same range from the router worked without any of these issues.I ended up hard-wiring the camera which made a vast performance improvement. Effective web device interface offering solid pan/tilt control and a reasonable quality picture other than the fact that the grass showed up as purple and my black sweatshirt showed up as various shades of blue regardless of contrast/brightness controls. Night vision worked particularly well and since it switches to monochrome, none of the color balance issues were present.If you don't care about the color issues and just want a simple IP webcam for security purposes this will do the trick for a reasonable price. I wanted to like this camera but it simply does not compare to the quality of my Foscam IP camera which has good colors and is more solidly built but that costs at least 50% more.Bottom line, its not terrible and the price is right so you get what you pay for, maybe not all of these cameras have the same extreme color problems but judging from one reply to my query in the answer section, I know of at least one other user with the same issue. Your experience may differ, unfortunately there is not a replacement option from this supplier, just a return one, I may reorder at a later date if the color issues get resolved but in the meantime it is on its way back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Great solution for a small business...
Reviews.Author: Dung D Luu
Reviews.Content: I bought this cam last year. It was fairly easy to setup on the network and access it viva DDNS. It is still working like a charm.  My family use on the daily bases to check on our business with our smart mobile devices.  We own Android and Apple.

Reviews.Title: pictures is not clear
Reviews.Author: Zhengyu
Reviews.Content: it can send email to you when it is triggered, but the picture is not clear. not recommended to any one.

Reviews.Title: Great IP Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Young "sabatorious"
Reviews.Content: Setting it up required some technical know how about wireless and local area networks, the instructions are decent but there is a little bit of poor English throughout. The good news is that you will come out smarter for having set it up :)The camera functions well. As mentioned, it's nice that the green LCD status light is able to be turned off. The IR works great, can see very well in the dark in a normal sized room. The remote motion control is fantastic and works great.All in all a great camera, just a bit hard to get setup - plan on a couple hours.

Reviews.Title: Does what it is suppose to do
Reviews.Author: Cyp
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that you can turn all the led lights off on the camera. (Unlike the Foscam which I have)Setting up of the camera is not for the technically lighthearted.-1 star for the Camera GUI. (Here is where they need to learn from Foscam)

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Daniel Amos
Reviews.Content: Like these cameras, they are priced fairly well and they work.They can be a bit tricky to set up if you are not technically inclined, but I have mine set up to email me when they detect motion and they also upload the pictures to my NAS.They also work well with remote apps or the web interface, but some tinkering my be required with your router for everything to work right.

Reviews.Title: Home Security at A Price All Can Afford!!
Reviews.Author: Philw19642002 "Phil"
Reviews.Content: If you want a simple security system set up then this is the way to go!! It was less than $50 but had to pay the manufacturer $40 for a set up support session!! :( That threw me!! The first tech that answered my call was going to do it for free but we got disconnected. He did not call me back. I called again but someone else answered and would not budge from that $40 charge however he did a good job of setting it up and showing me how to use it. It is AMAZING!! Night vision and all. You will have to run an extension power cord. It is wireless besides that. Sad to see it had to have a power cable but figured it out. This Will Blow You Away! Cheap home security surveillance straight to your PC or Mac! Overall all and through the hoops it is still a 5 Star deal to me!

Reviews.Title: Could be great, but company support (not) makes it much less so.
Reviews.Author: Ric Corless "Ric C"
Reviews.Content: Access to firmware updates is restricted, which makes keeping this otherwise reasonably nice room monitor more of a liability than an asset. Additionally, with continued use the camera is in or out of focus depending on when you check images. This is a supreme problem because people are unrecognizeable when it is in one of its "moods" for focus loss. Rebooting the camera solves this focus issue but having to do that is unacceptable. Thus the initial concern for access to updated firmware which is behind closed doors! Not a good choice under these circumstances; otherwise this would be a great addition to anyone's home security plan.

Reviews.Title: Works well, with caveats for mobile devices
Reviews.Author: Wolfman
Reviews.Content: The unit itself works well, however connection issues are consistent when using mobile devices. Poor or non-existent support for mobile devices. Complicated setup as well.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed.
Reviews.Author: Steve D. Noto
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price!  I saw a lot of mixed reviews.  Some people have problems logging in with email.  This is an easy straight forward install if you have ANY PC knowledge.  If you are not computer literate, get a friend to help you.  It comes with free Dynamic DNS, I have my own domain name, but you do not need to have one.  The instructions are poor, doesn't even tell you how to adjust focus.  From a functional standpoint, it does what I need.  I put it on a book shelve, connected external PC speakers.  I was able to use my iPhone on vacation to check on my pets.  It has a microphone, and with the speakers, we were able to talk to the pets.  The night vision is very good.  In fact, even it total darkness, I was able to view the images, pan, tilt.  If you are looking for perfectly bright colors, this is not a $1000 camera.  It does a great job for the Price.  I'm purchasing a few of the external cameras to mount outside also.

Reviews.Title: Directions are Horrible!
Reviews.Author: kathy
Reviews.Content: I can't get it to work.  The directions make no sense.  I have gone on the website to ask for assistance but nothing in return.

Reviews.Title: These cameras work great, day or night, exactly as described.
Reviews.Author: robert graham
Reviews.Content: I did the set up using temporary wired ethernet, then switched to wireless mode. Set up all 3 in half an hour.The picture is more than satisfactory for day and night surveillance, which is why I bought them. I set them up to email me with any activity from 10pm to 6 am.

Reviews.Title: I like it but cannot be linked into a security system.
Reviews.Author: Carol Szalach
Reviews.Content: I would have been perfect if I could have connected it to a larger security system where the police are notified if there is a  break in, etc.

Reviews.Title: Extremely easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Ron S.
Reviews.Content: These work great.  Although they are a little tricky at first to get used to the GUI interface and the somewhat broken english, they are really easy to connect.  I have still yet to figure out the remote (Internet) setup, but it's just a matter of finding the time to do it.  I have also not explored the recording function, but very pleased with these to be sure.  I would recommend them to anyone looking for a completely wireless camera setup.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Anthony Simons
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera.  It is great in low lighting and I like the panning and tilt features.  I had some difficulty setting it up at first but actually used a tech service to connect everything for me and some additional things.  The only problem is that I am unable to view it from a browser outside of my home.  I don't know why.  I can view it from my phone or IPad over Wi-Fi with no problem.  I am thinking about getting another one.  I would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Not Easy for a Mac
Reviews.Author: Louis Orrison
Reviews.Content: This product works OK on Macs. It took a few days for us to figure out how to set it up because the instructions are for a PC. The quality of the camera is good. We use it locally only. The night vision is better then some cameras we have tried.If your on a PC and have patience, this is a good camera. If you are on a Mac and have some time for trial and error, this is a good camera.

Reviews.Title: It works perfectly!! Good buy.
Reviews.Author: CHIUYUEH HUANG
Reviews.Content: This item delivered on schedule. The first impression is nice package and brand new product. Before I bought this item, the most concern is DDNS portion - including the difficulty to setup. It did come with unique Alias and domain name for each camera to access through WAN. For sure, you need to setup wireless networking for your IP camera first through cat5 cable (included in the box), using search tool from the CD. Then pull out the cable and restart to active wireless connection. The conclusion is nice product, nice images it took, amazing nigh vision function and remote control Pan/Tilt capability. The motion detect function work perfectly. I will recommend this product to my friends who need cost effective surveillance system.

Reviews.Title: Nice little cam
Reviews.Author: Kevin Lynch
Reviews.Content: I have had several web cams over the years from expensive to cheap.  This little guy hangs upside down on my porch.  connecting to my wireless was easy.  I can connect to the camera with IE, Firefox or my windows phone.  IE has a feature so you can listen to the mic on the camera or  you can load the software.  The colors during the day are a little weird but for the money what can I ask for?  Night vision is great.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price!
Reviews.Author: Val
Reviews.Content: The only problem this unit won't allow to turn off the IR function. If trying the outside from the windows you will get the IR light reflecting thru the glass.

Reviews.Title: Took a little bit longer to set up
Reviews.Author: James O. Montgomery, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Got the camera and couldn't get the included setup software to find the camera. I had to use some network skills and use  packet capture program to find out that a static IP was set up on the unit of 192.168.0.178. I set my pc up in the same subnet, was able to access it and set it to get an IP address from my router. Haven't got audio working yet, but I haven't gotten that far into the manual either... otherwise, a good camera for my uses.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, terrible audio, bad app support, bad instructions
Reviews.Author: J.T. Shaver
Reviews.Content: The video and features of this camera are good, but the instructions suck bad, so expect to Google for better ones.The audio is HORRIBLE. Turn it up higher than 10% of the max volume and it's got a TON of noise, which makes it worthless for a baby monitor, which is why I, and others bought it. Now it's a spycam to watch our baby mess around without audio.On top of that, there's 100 different apps for Apple and Android, and the vast majority of them suck bigtime. Some support audio, but the video sucks, some vice versa. Most apps worth anything you will have to pay for, so expect that.

Reviews.Title: Good product, works as it says on the websit
Reviews.Author: Raynold A. Mathew "raynold"
Reviews.Content: It is a good product and easy to set up, works as mentioned on the website.However I have still not succeeded in viewing the activities through my iphone from a remote location, may be because of inter net connectivity problems. When I am at home in the next room and within wifi range, then i can view the camera through my iphone.One negative of the camera, is it has to be always connected to the router. I would wish the camera can be fixed on a high wall and it connects wirelessly with the router and images can be captured on a phone or a pc. May be this is possible, I still have not figured it yet. If some one knows, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Karl Toledo
Reviews.Content: I have purchased a couple of these and they are still up and running with no issues.  Great picture clarity.. with the addition of PTZ.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent cameras for that price
Reviews.Author: H. Martins "Helder Martins"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a couple and recommended to 2 family members who acquired lots of them. They are great, easy to set up (but only if you look in Internet, the instructions and the DVD that comes with them is totally useless!) and they can really do anything a expensive camera can do if you buy the proper app for your mobile device (you could record, listen, monitor, etc). Definitely would recommend it to anyone any time.

Reviews.Title: No Problems
Reviews.Author: Suzie Smith
Reviews.Content: Works great! No issues.Well worth the price. I would recommend it to my friends. May buy more to add in the future.

Reviews.Title: Works well!
Reviews.Author: Jon A. Parr
Reviews.Content: Our neighbor recommended this as a cheaper alternative to a baby cam...hooked up in the nursery, has audio and night vision, and there's an app for it on iPhone and Android systems. Not bad for 50$!

Reviews.Title: Great Low Budget IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Luke Adams
Reviews.Content: This camera performs exactly as advertised.  Setup of the camera isn't difficult, but definitely requires some knowledge of how to work with a wifi router.  I was able to use two iPhone apps to connect to the camera, camviewer, and "baby monitor for iphone app".  Both of these apps were able to pick up the audio from the camera.  I will be testing some android apps shortly.Pros:-Low Price-Night Vision-Works on the iPhone-Horizontal and Vertical scanningCons:-Audio isn't crisp-Video is a little jittery-Browser Camera Viewer doesn't have digital zoom

Reviews.Title: can't get it to work
Reviews.Author: tammy
Reviews.Content: i followed all directions on CD plus book and no matter what it just gets stuck on search screen.  nothing else will go from there.  i bough this in hopes to be able to record but i cannot even get it programmed.  guess i'm just going to have to send it back. was looking for something a bit simpler to install but oh well.

Reviews.Title: Needs better focus!
Reviews.Author: D. Smith "xxxdimension"
Reviews.Content: Works well but the cameras resolution is quite blurry. I have another camera that cost less and has better resolution.

Reviews.Title: sweet
Reviews.Author: Andrew Trossman
Reviews.Content: It's a bit clunky to configure - but if you know what you're doing with networking it's fine.  Picture is good, night vision is good.  Just wish the UI worked better for non-windoze non IE browsers.  For instance sound does not work with macos, ios, android, linux...

Reviews.Title: Camera is good - Cant get wireless to work
Reviews.Author: Angelo1963
Reviews.Content: This is the second one I've purchased.  The manual is the worst thing written!!  lolSlugged my way to get the first camera operating via my wired network. It connected and operates wonderfully.  I tried many times to get the wireless feature to work with no success!Purchased a second camera to add to the network.  Same nearly useless manual. Got it integrated with the exsisting camera on my network. Again, no success with wireless!Wansview will only support it if you bought it from THEM!  They even offer remote setup! If you buy it from anyone else, you're on your own!Really wish I could communicate with those who had success setting up the wireless!!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Whitey
Reviews.Content: These work great. They can be a little tricky to set up if you try accessing externally of your home network, but very possible. The quality of the picture is acceptable. Not good enough to get a license plate or facial identification from more than 10 feet away, but you get a good idea of what is going on.

Reviews.Title: WansView IP camera, a mini robot
Reviews.Author: A. Khan "ak"
Reviews.Content: For a small price of about 50 dollars (shipping included), the camera has worked good. I am not an expert in IT but know enough to get things going by following directions. The camera was easy to configure and setup, the image quality is good and lots of functions as mentioned in the ad. I ordered two of these in order to monitor while we are away on leave or even when we are out for a whole day and want to see what our pet cat is up-to. I have not figured out the voice and sound feature yet, but according to the manufacturer's manual, it does contain this, so I am researching. The fifth star that this item cannot get is due to the fact that the manual is written by an expert who does not realize that not all customers are experts, assumptions are made I think that the reader understands fully when an abbreviated statement is made. Although a CD is added with a manual, the manual lacks in lots of information and I am now preparing to get on the reviews to gain access to set up information, i will not go to the manufacturer to ask questions since they have done enough putting together the manual that is hard to follow. The alarm and e-mail functions are yet to be set, so i don't know how these will function, i am sure once set these will be ok.Anyway, the camera has commenced working, pan, tilt speed control etc.functions are happening and i am glad that i can do this via wifii without any difficulty. My advice to the manufacturer, subcontract the manual portion so that a proper instruction can be put together with detailed step by step fashion so that this excellent piece of equipment can be more user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: The camera works really well, and I was even able to do all of the setup without any access to a PC (I used the IP Scanner app). It even works wirelessly and I can view it from my iPhone, which is awesome.  (This is my first time setting up an IP camera, so it really isn't that hard).A couple notes: The default IP address for the camera was incorrect in my instructions - my cameras default IP was 192.168.0.178, so if you're having problems, try that!  Also, in my router settings, I had to change mine to channel 1 instead of auto-select before it would work over wifi.The night vision is surprisingly good, as is the picture quality.  The whole thing is better than I was expecting.I had one hold up as I was sent the European power supply on accident, but the seller was extremely accommodating, and gave me a partial refund in order to purchase a new one.  The customer service is really great.The only negative about this camera is the sound - it is almost entirely feedback.  Lots of people don't use the sound, but I am using this as a baby monitor, so I really need sound.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: R. Finlayson
Reviews.Content: I use this for monitoring my toddler when I can't be in the room.  It works as well in basic ways as my foscam camera, which cost about fifty percent more than this Wansview.  Wansview differs from the foscam I have in four specific ways: it does not have two way audio, it has a lesser quality lens, it does not have IR shutoff, and it has far poorer instruction.  I used a Mac to set both up.  You just need to download an ip camera or device tool for finding the ip addresses of devices on your network. Some router interface pages can also do this. If you have an iPhone or iPad, use app fing for this.  To view outside your home network, you will have to set up port forwarding. If you are not network savvy (I am not at all), I recommend doing research ahead of time. It took me about 8 hours to learn how to set up my network for this camera. I should say I have zero IT experience.

Reviews.Title: Misses Mark
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Camera not easy to setup.  WI/FI unreliable.  Works during daytime does not work  at night.  Camera reboots next morning sometimes.  Internet access is particularily difficult to set up.  Did work when it was finally set up correctly.  Alarms to Email also worked but again not easy to set up.Overall cameras reliability is very poor and only suitable for a hardwired usage or someone who does not need nightime usage and can resert camera each morning after WI/FI comes down(reset=unplug and repluging the camera).  Picture quality is reasonable,  some false alerts for change in lighting(sun emerges from behind clouds).Plan to spend hours on net to setup.  Instructions for WI/FI, internet, and Email very poorly documented.  Hardwired instruction were clear and camera worked flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Carr "JSC"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras one for the front of my home and one for the backyard so I can check in on my place from time to time.  The directions for getting everything working are fine IF you are a computer whiz, if not, it can be a challenge!  I managed to get through everything ok and I have it hooked up to my wireless network and I can view it from outside the house remotely because I have a DYNDNS account that I forward everything to so I can see it as I have a dynamic IP address coming in.  the camera works fine the controls are fine and everything runs great.  It does what it was supposed to do and as for the audio I could care less about it I just want to see the view.  It's a great buy at this price and it actually does what it is supposed to do.  I even set up the email and checked that out as well and it works too.

Reviews.Title: Died after 2 months
Reviews.Author: C. Caswell
Reviews.Content: Set up was pretty straight forward and the camera worked great, and then, it didn't work at all.The camera was installed  in the front window inside my home(aimed at the front door), it worked for about 2 months and then it just died. I was unable to contact the seller or get any assistance from Wansview. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Not for Macs
Reviews.Author: TreeFab
Reviews.Content: This is a PC camera, something I didn't realize wouldn't work on a Mac. If you have the knowledge and the time to set it up on a Mac, then, please don't let my review sway you, but I am not tech enough, so back it went!

Reviews.Title: less expensive Loftek/Foscam
Reviews.Author: desertfox "desert fox"
Reviews.Content: This unit is the same as a Loftek CX220 or the similar looking Foscam. It can be had for under $50. I use it on a wired Ethernet connection and am happy with the performance. Wireless use of any of these IP cams is pretty shakey, slow, may dropout, unless positioned right next to the WiFi router. Recommended for wired use.

Reviews.Title: The little camera that could(n't)!
Reviews.Author: SDRob01
Reviews.Content: I have other IP Cameras that work much better than this one at comparable price.First, the Good:1. Video quality seems good. That's it.Now, the Bad:1. Network settings are idiotic.  It comes "preset" with static IP 192.168.0.178, DHCP turned off.  So if your home or work network uses anything besides that, you have to first change your entire network, or find another router (or cross-over cable), change your computer IP settings to the 192.168.0.x subnet, then connect to 192.168.0.178 via web or included software to change it to DHCP or set a static IP, then undo everything in reverse order.  Ridiculous.  Other cameras come DHCP enabled, you plug it in, it gets an IP on your subnet, you connect to it, done. This one, fail.2. E-mail alerts don't work. Again, other IP cameras I have send e-mail alerts just fine. This one will not, using the same settings, as well as every other possible setting (TLS, SSL, SMARTTLS), port 465, 587, you name it, I tried it. Nothing.  Noteworthy: all these cameras appear similar in their backend firmware, only the user interface and software varies and this camera lacks there.3. Cannot save PTZ presets.  Really? That's a shame.4. No product support on manufacturer website.  Lists many of their other model numbers, but the NCB541W is nowhere to be found. If you hope to find firmware for it, keep hoping.5. 2 of the 3 of these cameras I got failed to work.  Even after following steps in #1, 2 of the 3 would never respond on the network.  No response to ping, no web response. Just sat there blinking green light. It's possible that these had their network settings changed then were returned by someone, and got reshipped to me, but by this point, I was over it. Returning all 3 and sticking with the EasyN brand that worked much better, has more features, is also on Amazon, and cost the same.

Reviews.Title: I can't get the supplied DDNS to work.
Reviews.Author: RP
Reviews.Content: I can't get the supplied DDNS to work. When I enter the site into the address bar, it comes back with an error message stating it can't connect or that it's an invalid account. I purchased the camera to check my property while "I am away from my house". I can look out the window if home so I don't care so much about the LAN part. I've gotten the port forwarding set up with my router, but can't get the IP address to work away from the house either. I haven't gotten any response from the seller yet, but if they can help me get it going, I'll revisit my review. I'll most likely be returning it if things don't get better.

Reviews.Title: Complicated setup -- Amazing Results
Reviews.Author: send4hlp
Reviews.Content: I own 5 of these ip cams (note that they are mass produced and a name is slapped on them, ie wanscam, wansview, etc, so if they look like the picture just go for the best deal) and I think they are WELL worth the cost.PROS:-The most bang for your buck hands down. You will not be able to find a camera that has IR lights, 2-way audio & talk, wireless, pan/tilt, internet access, password protection, and much more. For example, the next best brand is Foscam and they are more than double the cost.-Once setup there is no maintenance. Simply log on through your local network or anywhere in the world through your phone or computer. You can setup the camera to remember anywhere from 1 to 16 focus points or manually control the adjustment to view anywhere it is able to look at.-The included wall mount can be used in any position. You can invert the camera and easily change the settings to mirror the image and the mount is sturdy and I have never had an issue with it.CONS:-PROGRAMMING IS TERRIBLE! But in the sense you need to know about the internet and routers. Honestly, if you are not familiar port forwarding, remote IP connections, data transfer security, IP addresses, etc, then you will have a very hard time getting the full function out of this equipment. The included CD is only useful for finding the IP camera on your network, but programming it to get access to it through your cell or remote computer takes a lot more doing. Their webpage (for all names associated with this product) is lacking on all setup help.-2 way audo is not up to par with respect to using it to talk through the camera if on an outside network. The camera's mic is good for hearing what is within 10ft of the camera, but when you try to talk back you will have a hard time getting the person to understand you unless you are on an extremely fast home and remote network.OVERALL:If you are reasonably savvy with the internet and programming routers then you can probably work your way through it. That being said, if you can set it up there is NO second to the value of this product; you will be happy. I have this camera mounted inside and outside (open air under carport but no cover) and have not had any problem with dew or camera failure due to weather though rain does not touch it directly. The internet interface works best with IE but can be used on Chrome or Firefox (but note you will not have all the options if not under IE).If you would like further insight into this product, please comment; I would be happy to help if I can.

Reviews.Title: takes pictures of shadows moving on my driveway
Reviews.Author: Viking Navy
Reviews.Content: So I get a lot of pictures of the shadow of the garage moving over the driveway in the afternoon.When there is a person in the area, It seems to take 6 pictures, then wait a minute.  So I see a person come to my door and then nothing.  They leave during the minute of wait.

Reviews.Title: Too many issues.
Reviews.Author: Anthony Pecoraro
Reviews.Content: This is an updated review. Setting up the camera wasn't that difficult, though you should allow a half a day to get it connected to your wi-fi, put your schedule in correctly, etc. I did not set up the WAN interface because of the possibility of a back door allowing those who know about it access to the camera and my network.The color is very odd.  The camera inverts dark colors, so that a black sweatshirt looks white in the image. This has to be the IR feature, but with all the lights on inside it still acts this way. I have not found any color settings either in the web interface or in the manual. The color saturation level is so low it is almost black & white.The email feature works great and allows you to send the images to multiple addresses. So I set it to email my work address as well as a personal address which I can access anywhere. I can access the interface via my android tablet when connected to my network as well, which is nice.The scheduler is tedious, because you have to click these little 15 minute boxes for all the time you want the camera operating. For example, if you want it operating while you are at work, you have to click four boxes for each hour, and do that for every day you work. It sure would have been nice to just shift-click end points and be done with it.  Unfortunately, my unit would regularly ignore the schedule and start flooding me with emails when I walked in the door or when I woke up in the morning, times when the alarm was scheduled to be off.I also could not change the default "record to" folder. It was set to C:\Users\Public\Documents. I tried changing it to another location and it refused, saying "Set the recording path fail" in broken English. As it turns out, I couldn't get it to record to any location.I am also unhappy that the IR LED's glow whenever the room is dim, giving away the camera's existence and location. It would be much better if the LED's were fully infrared and couldn't be seen in the dark so that an intruder wouldn't notice it before being photographed or recorded.I've decided to return it. It just has too many issues which for me render it unusable. It is cheap, but as with so many things, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Great idea. Lousy execution
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Motorized and versatile little camera could be so much more if it could focus properly. Also is not fully compatible with apple products.  Does not zoom on a MAC.  Why not?  Apple has the best video yet this was built for Microsoft based systems. Seems like poor planning and execution.

Reviews.Title: Difficult setup, wireless is useless
Reviews.Author: Wizzbert "wizzbert"
Reviews.Content: This product is terribly difficult to setup if you have little tech knowledge. Luckily there are some detailed instructions by others you tube that will help.Once setup, if the device is connected to your router via cable, it will work as desired.However, the wireless is very unreliable. The device does not keep the assigned IP and therefore stops responding to remote access requests. You have to reset it up or reboot it.I would NOT recommend if you are doing wireless access since the camera seems to "forget" what its IP was set to.

Reviews.Title: too hard to hook up
Reviews.Author: Full circle car care
Reviews.Content: never go cheap you get what you pay for spent 10 hours trying to get it to work . no number to call for help.

Reviews.Title: Not What It Claims
Reviews.Author: DC - MN
Reviews.Content: I am attempting to work with the seller to resolve my tremendous problems with this product. I hope that will be possible.  Whereas it regards the product itself... as an IT professional and computer engineer for 20 years, I would advice against this product, because after extensive testing and attempts to make it work as advertised, I have determined it is impossible to do so. It is not able to do what it claims in any way, or any level. The wi-fi is very unstable and very difficult to set (re-setting a constant issue).  It is not a 'live' feed as claimed. It requires a FT browser IP to be open by user, for it to feed or alert (which is very impractical.  The picture is incredibly poor and frustratingly slow (choppy frames).  I would not advice anyone to buy it, unless you enjoy days and days of terrible frustration and sorrow.

Reviews.Title: No wifi on the unit I got.
Reviews.Author: B. Grenier "Zeph55"
Reviews.Content: Tech support: Wow, it is like a foreign country:After two months, I finally got through to 'tech support'. Here is a portion of our chat:[8:37:20 PM] Brian: Is the camera working over wifi? No...[8:37:28 PM] Trene: it can be[8:37:45 PM] Brian: you just checked; it does not[8:38:25 PM] Brian: Are you willing to exchange?[8:38:31 PM] Irene  it should be the setting problem[8:38:48 PM] Brian: you just checked the settings.OK, that was part of the chat...About the camera, the pan and tilt was nice the first day, but once it was setup, those features were not used.The resolution was poor; I could not get a clear image. IR was non-existent.The way that I am using this camera is with a cat5e cable.Good Luck to you if you purchase it.

Reviews.Title: This product does not work!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Geni Monroe
Reviews.Content: This product does not work!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!It does not talk to the software even after working on this product for over 12 hours.

Reviews.Title: Not so much
Reviews.Author: Cheri W.
Reviews.Content: So I thought this may help me keep an eye on my dog who likes to chew furniture or whatever she can get a hold of. It does.... if I am connected to the same wireless network. I am not a tech savvy person so maybe I am doing it all wrong but I was under the impression that I could use this while at work as well. The instructions are pretty much useless. The picture on it is great, even at night but the whole reason I purchased it is not working for me. If I ever figure it out I will update my review.

Reviews.Title: Wanswiew Wireless IP Camera Pan
Reviews.Author: joanne
Reviews.Content: Really liked the idea but could not get it to work. The instructions are to vauge. Sent it back.  I was disappointed as I wanted it to work out. Might try some other brand.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Ralph Petralia
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these. One works the other was DOA. It took me a month to get around to setting it up so I missed the 30 day return policy by 4 days.

ProductInfo.Features:
Sensor: CMOS sensor. Total of pixel: 300k.
Pan Coverage:270 degree. Tilt Coverage: 120 degree. Resolution: 640*480(VGA)/320*240(QVGA)/160*120(QQVGA). Compression: MJPEG.
Basic Protocol: TCP/IP, UDP/IP, HTTP, SMTP, FTP, DHCP, DDNS, UPNP, NTP, PPPOE. Dual way audio: support. Motion Detection: support.
The IP Camera combines a high quality digital video camera with network connectivity and a powerful web server to bring clear video to your desktop from anywhere on your local network or over the Internet.
Package includes: 1 x IP Camera, 1 x Antenna, 1 x Base, 1 x Power Adapter, 1 x Network Cable, 1 x CD Driver, Screws.
ProductInfo.Name: Wansview Wireless IP Camera Pan/Tilt/ Night Vision/ Internet Surveillance Built-in Microphone With Phone remote monitoring support - white
